titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jennie Langthorne school certificates 1977.483
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:10:44 +0000.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Miss Whitcomb's French, English, and German Day School for Young Ladies and Children

did.abstract: This collection consists of two certificates issued to Jennie Langthorne for penmanship and the completion of a course of study by Miss Whitcomb's Seminary (formally called Miss Whitcomb's French, English, and German Day School for Young Ladies and Children), located at 191 Clinton Street in Brooklyn, N.Y. Both documents are dated June 9, 1884.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Jennie Langthorne school certificates, 1977.483, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
